title: The Birth of Rama
summary: King Dasharatha performs a yajna to be blessed with children. Rama is born along with his three brothers.
moral: Faith and righteousness bring divine blessings.
quote: Let the sacred yajna bring forth sons to the king.

title: Rama Breaks Shiva's Bow
summary: Rama lifts and breaks the mighty bow of Shiva during Sita's swayamvar, winning her hand in marriage.
quote: He who strings this bow shall marry Sita.

title: Rama’s Exile
summary: Due to Kaikeyi’s demand, Rama is exiled for 14 years. He leaves Ayodhya with Sita and Lakshmana.
moral: Respect for promises is higher than personal comfort.
quote: I gladly accept this exile to honor my father’s word.

title: Shurpanakha's Revenge
summary: Shurpanakha is humiliated by Rama and Lakshmana. She provokes Ravana to abduct Sita.
moral: Actions driven by ego can cause destruction.
quote: I shall seek vengeance for this insult!

title: Sita’s Abduction
summary: Ravana kidnaps Sita while Rama and Lakshmana are away. Jatayu tries to save her but fails.
moral: Courage can shine even in defeat.

title: Hanuman Meets Rama
summary: Hanuman becomes a devotee of Rama and offers to help in the search for Sita.
quote: I am at your service, my lord.

title: Hanuman’s Leap to Lanka
summary: Hanuman leaps across the ocean to find Sita in Lanka and delivers Rama’s message.
moral: Faith and determination can achieve the impossible.

title: Building the Bridge
summary: The Vanara army builds a bridge across the ocean to reach Lanka and rescue Sita.
moral: Unity and teamwork can overcome great obstacles.
quote: Lay down the stones in the name of Rama!

title: The Fall of Ravana
summary: After a fierce battle, Rama defeats Ravana and rescues Sita.
moral: Evil, no matter how powerful, will fall before righteousness.

title: Rama’s Coronation
summary: Rama returns to Ayodhya and is crowned king. Peace and prosperity prevail.
moral: Goodness, patience, and sacrifice lead to ultimate victory.
